lenders.loan_because: Some folks just need a little help.
lenders.occupational_info: Sell outsourcing solutions for small to medium sized businesses. - 2nd grade teacher.

lenders.name: michael
lenders.loan_because: I loan because, there is so much we take for granted when it comes to the value of the money we earn.  What we spend in a few days can often provide weeks of food and housing for others around the world.

lenders.name: Alice
lenders.loan_because: everyone needs help sometimes
lenders.occupational_info: I help people make safe and clean drinking water.

lenders.name: fabio
lenders.loan_because:
Each one has to make his part.

And I trust people.

lenders.name: david
lenders.loan_because:
Finally!! A non-profit with the right idea. 
 I find that most charities out there are inefficient. They keep giving money and food away year after year and it seems to be a never ending cycle.
 Kiva's model is the best way to economic progress. Helping someone with their business by "lending" money promotes self-sufficiency and pride, and will also build the local economy.

lenders.name: Nisha
lenders.loan_because: its a small step that makes a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I figure out solutions to business problems. It's just like solving puzzles, except with businesses and numbers.

lenders.name: Graham

lenders.occupational_info: I work with the internet everyday in travel and financial services

lenders.loan_because: It is consistent with economic development.
lenders.occupational_info: We learn economics.

lenders.occupational_info: I'm studying Conservation Biology in NYC, planning on moving to some very remote place to work once I'm done with my MA.

lenders.loan_because: People have helped me.

lenders.occupational_info: No matter who you are, or where you are on life's journey, you are welcome at Meridian United Church of Christ.

lenders.name: Aidan's Mommy
lenders.loan_because: ....we all deserve better chances in life.

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: to help others there are two things one can do, you can teach new skills or you can help provide the tools  for success to one who already has a skill

lenders.name: Sidney
lenders.loan_because: I feel I have a responsibility as someone who can help, to help, as much I am capable. I wouldn't be where I am without help from others, and I want to pass that support along to someone else.
lenders.occupational_info: I make moving grahics and art for television commercials.

lenders.name: Lexy
lenders.loan_because: this is a great way to do it.

lenders.name: daniel

I am grateful for this opportunity to help others realize their full potential when they would otherwise be unable to.

lenders.name: Siobhan
lenders.loan_because:
I can.

I think that by loaning through Kiva, I'm helping change someone's life. Someone will be able to plant their crops or start a business or help their children because they've gotten help when they needed it. I'm glad I can be a part of that.

Also, I am a recent convert to veganism and would like to support a more peaceful and respectful way of life through my loans.

the world needs more hope, trust, social justice, personal connection ang HAPPINESS.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because:
I'm sick of watching members of the so-called "first world" frittering away their money on rubbish. Kiva gives me the opportunity to give some direct help, to do something real. I hope to see the money again, but if I don't then at least I've helped someone, that's all that matters. When the funds come back, they will then go to help someone else.

I won't be withdrawing any funds, I'll just wait for some repayments before I reinvest. The funds I have invested will ALWAYS stay with Kiva.
lenders.occupational_info: I do my best to fix broken things.

lenders.name: Woody
lenders.loan_because: Kiva is a great way to help people and change lives. Too many in the world only see America as its evil, busybody government, not the love filled hearts of typical Americans. Kiva helps change that. We loan money via people borrowing to expand farms and dairys because we are VERY concerned about food shortages with world population growing 75 million a year.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a wall street financial money manager in mutual funds. Holly is retired. We live in Maryland & Wyoming. We have 1 adult son lives near Hershey Pa.

lenders.name: Thaimaaopas.fi

lenders.name: Rabbi Asher Knight
lenders.loan_because:
The highest form of Tzedakah, charity or distributive justice, involves helping individuals to become self-supporting and self-sufficient. 

Rabbi Hillel said:
If I am not for myself, who will be for me?
If I am only for myself, what am I?
If not now, when?
lenders.occupational_info: I am the rabbinic liaison to the  Social Justice Council and help oversee all Social Justice within the congregation. I also have a full range of rabbinical responsibilities in leading worship, officiating at Life Cycle events, teaching, preaching, counseling and serving as a full member of the synagogue's pastoral team.

I loan so women can use their art to support themselves and create a better life.

Creating art is a personal journey and sometimes allows us to discovery so much about ourselves, the world and how we live in it.  I am fascinated in learning about other artists, their work, and what is behind them.

lenders.name: Mari Fraga Memorial Fund
lenders.loan_because:
Hi Everyone. This is a memorial fund for the sweet, wonderful, and amazing person Mariana Fraga or simply 'Mari'. She was an amazing person, a wonderful classmate, a great friend, a loving wife, and so many more great things. As you can see from the picture, she loved food as well as she loved life. I think more can be said here and I encourage all her friends and family to send their thoughts and memories to add here to show the world that Mariana was THE BEST person I ever knew. We will all miss her deeply, and hopefully her memory can live on strongly by using Kiva to give to others. 

Mari loved Brazil and did a lot of translations for Mozambique so loans will be chosen to organizations/people there. She also was very thoughtful about gender equality, and I think any projects which help women achieve the equality they deserve would also be in the spirit of her will. Please, feel free to e-mail me kobrien at sfsu . edu and give suggestions for groups to donate to. I started the fund out with $25, but I will soon be adding more and I hope you find it in your hearts to give as well. 

*Update: The fund is now made non-withdrawable status in the spirit of it being a memorial fund. Also, I have been asking Kiva to work harder on getting partners in Brazil, but it seems that it is going to take a bit of time (1 year+) so probably this fund will loan to Mozambique and other Latin American countries in the mean time. The loans will go predominantly to female entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info:
Asides from working and graduating with high honors from San Francisco State University, Mariana also volunteered as a translator at Kiva and has done hundreds of translations. 
Here is a poem written by Mariana that her loving husband Joe shared with us:
 
Perky

I have this image in my head
This really perky girl
"Whee!"
She is always smiling
"Yeah, I am good with anything"
She is patient and always answers even the most stupid questions
"I think if it's red you should not park there"
She always has a positive attitude
"But, hey, on the bright side..."
She doesn't mind if people misinterpret facts
"Well, that's not what I said, but I see why she would say that..."
She doesn't mind if everyone is late, or if they never come
"Oh, no worries, I know you guys are busy..."
She never speaks ill of anyone
"Well, you have to try to put yourself in her shoes..."

So I try to be that way.

But sometimes it's really fucking hard.

lenders.occupational_info: Our shop specializes in the repair and rebuilding of manual and automatic transmissions and all-wheel drive transfer cases in all makes and models of passenger cars and trucks. We also repair and replace clutch assemblies in the same vehicles. Annie, whose picture appears on this page,  was our friend and helper, and has passed on to a better place; she is greatly missed.
